xml:
(The water ripples in the breeze as the seagulls fly overhead. The ubiqui- tous windmills of this bright white world turn, their heavy creaking sound sailing on the air. Beneath the water, schools of fish swim in slow currents. High above the water, cable cars traverse over wires in the sunlight, clanging as they move along. At the world's central point, a grand tower stands. Inside the tower, the sun shines warmly on a pair of young boys seated at a table. The wall-length curtains ripple as the breeze wafts through the open window. On the table sits a game board with twenty playing pieces, thirteen black and seven white)
Boy in Black: Have you heard of the ancient Keyblade War?
Boy in White: Huh? Of course I have.
Boy in Black: Long ago, Keyblade wielders waged a war over the ownership of light.
(The Boy in Black moves one of his black pieces and takes one of the white pieces, as you would in a chess game)
Boy in White: Yeah, the Master's favorite story.
(The Boy in White takes a black piece with one of his white pieces)
Boy in Black: I wonder what they planned on doing with Kingdom Hearts after... making it appear.
Boy in White: Who knows? I don't get why anyone would initiate a war.
(The boys keep playing)
Boy in Black: So...you know the "Lost Masters"?
Boy in White: Who?
Boy in Black: They're the ones who started the Keyblade War.
Boy in White: Never heard of 'em. Where'd you hear about that?
Boy in Black: Or...they're the ones for whom the war started.
Boy in White: I'm not following you.
Boy in Black: You can drop the facade.
Boy in White: Facade?
Boy in Black: "On that land shall darkness prevail and light expire." A prospective Keyblade Master should know this.
Boy in White: If you say so.
Boy in Black: The Gazing Eye sees the fate of the World.
(The Boy in Black looks up to a Keyblade on the wall with an eye set in its teeth)
The Boy in Black: The future--it's already been written.
Boy in White: Really? I'm not so sure about that.
(He picks up a white piece bearing a blank heart token)
Bow in White: Besides, who's to say I can't change it? And maybe light will prevail.
(The Boy in Black gives a small laugh)
Boy in Black: Pretty confident.
(He moves to claim another white piece)
Boy in Black: But things aren't in your favor.
Boy in White: Perhaps. But unlike darkness, there is more to light than meets the eye. You might be surprised.
(The Boy in Black smiles, peering at the other boy with his gray eyes)
Boy in Black: Oh, I hope so.
(Far into the future, Sora, Donald and Goofy meet at Yen Sid's Mysterious Tower. The trio stand at attention as the former Keyblade Master sits in his tall chair)
Yen Sid: In order to defeat Xehanort, there are allies we must gather, acting now to rouse them from their slumber. We have discussed this before, Sora.
(They nod)
Yen Sid: Your Mark of Mastery exam was conducted in the hopes you would acquire the power to wake them. However, the darkness nearly took control of you, and your grasp of your new abilities leaves much to be desired.
(Sora looks sad and Donald and Goofy share concerned faces)
Yen Sid: Furthermore, Xehanort nearly made you his vessel, and in the process stripped you of most of the power you had gained by then. I suspect you have already noticed this, correct? But first, you must regain all the strength you have lost. Perhaps it is foolish to expect a complete recovery, but it is absolutely vital you perfect one power--the power of waking, which you failed to master during your exam. There's someone who lost his strength and found it again, a true hero to whom you ought to pay a visit.
(Sora perks up and strikes various bodybuilding poses, to Donald's less- than-amusement)
Yen Sid: Perhaps he can point you in the right direction.
Sora (saluting): Got it.
(The sorcerer nods)
Donald Master Yen Sid...
Goofy You can count on us to take care of Sora!
Yen Sid: I would have it no other way. I put Sora in your hands.
Donald (to Sora): And don't forget, we'll keep an eye on you.
(Donald holds out his hand)
Goofy Oh, this is gonna be lots of fun!
(Goofy joins with his own hand)
Sora It's not a vacation!
(Sora completes the trio)
Sora Let's go!
(They stand at attention toward Yen Sid)
Sora, Donald & Goofy: Count on us!
(Later, the three fly in the Gummi Ship, seemingly going nowhere. Donald and Sora cross their arms impatiently. Sora whines as Donald glares at him)
Sora How're we supposed to get there now?
Donald What? I thought you knew!
Goofy Looks like all the old highways are closed. Didn't Master Yen Sid say that Sora should trust the guidance his heart gives?
Donald C'mon, Sora. Which way?
Sora Ummm...
Donald Hey, would you get serious?
Sora Gimme a break, I'm trying. These things take time!
(Donald sighs)
Goofy Well, since we've already been before, why don't you try picturing out friends like we're there?
(Sora stands up and walks behind his chair)
Sora Hmmm...
(He strikes a bicep pose, mimicking Hercules)
Donald Well?
Sora Sorry, I got nothin'. What did you expect?
(Donald falls back into his chair, exasperated)
Goofy "May your heart be your guiding key."
Sora Huh? What's that?
Goofy Master Yen Sid always said that, right before we went off on any of our real important adventures.
Sora Really? (to Donald) Ring a bell?
Donald Uh-uh...
Goofy Maybe I just imagined it.
(He scratches his head)
Sora "May my heart be my guiding key."
(He gets an idea and runs back to his chair)
Sora I've got it!
(He summons the Keyblade and aims it forward. The tip glows brightly and a portal opens ahead of the ship)
Donald & Goofy: It's a gate!
(Sora sits in his chair)
Sora All right! Olympus Coliseum, here we come!
(He grabs the controls and the ship speeds off into space through the portal)
KINGDOM HEARTS II.9
Narrator At long last, the time had come. The planets were edging into perfect alignment...and the plan Hades devised eighteen years ago was about to reach fruition. The Fates had predicted this very future--the day he would sieze control of Olympus and rule over all the cosmos. Hades' previous attempts--using Terra, Cloud, and Auron to advance his plans for conquest-- had failed. The hour was not yet right. But now the planets were aligned and nothing could possibly go wrong. A wave of darkness lanced down from their celestial rank, and one by one, Hades freed the Titans from their prison--some of them the same monstrosities that Sora and his friends had already fought and bested before. With both the Titans and his longing for vengeance against Zeus reinvigorated, Hades began his attack on Olympus.
(Sora, Donald and Goofy land on Olympus in a small cave)
Sora Huh? Uh...
(He sees no one around)
Sora No fanfare?
(He mocks playing a trumpet. Donald listens for one, but shakes his head)
Donald Un-uh...
(Goofy looks around)
Goofy Nope, looks like we missed the Coliseum.
(Sora continues looking around)
Donald Sora, YOU opened the gate!
(Sora scratches his head bashfully)
Sora I was a little off again. Sorry! We'll find him. But we need to go!
(He starts walking in a direction)
Donald Up the mountain?
Sora Yeah. "Up" is the usual direction.
Goofy Well, never hurts to have your head in the clouds.
Sora Exactly!
(Smirking, he makes a tough fist. Goofy giggles and Donald gives a sigh. Sora continues walking with Goofy following behind)
Sora Hey. We're leaving!
(Donald opens his eyes and jumps with a shout, running up to catch them. Soon, they reach a clearing with a few trees)
Goofy I think we might be goin' in circles.
(Sora thinks)
Donald (judgmentally): Sora...
Sora Did I make a turn at the wrong rock?
(He walks closer to the edge and calls out)
Sora Hey, Hercules! Where are youuu?
(A wisp of smoke lands near them and out of the cloud appears...)
Hades All right. I know I dotted my I's, crossed my T's, zeroed the hero. So what gives? Who could possibly be trying to give me a migraine by yodeling that yutz's name?
Sora Really? Hades?
(Hades sighs)
Hades Oh, it's just you. Oy vey.
Sora It's just us? Even for you that's cold.
Hades Don't forget...I can always (yelling) turn up the heat!
Goofy Wait. If Hades is here, then where's Herc?
(Hades whirls toward Goofy, startling him)
Hades What is everyone's infatuation with that dolt?!
(The blue flame on his head bursts into a large red one, turning his skin red as well. He glares at Goofy for a moment before cooling himself down, becoming blue again)
Hades You know what? Never mind. Never mind. I'm cool. I'm good. Because...Wonderboy'll be outta my hair soon enough.
(The trio summon their weapons)
Sora So you're up to no good again!
Goofy Of course he is.
Donald You bet!
Hades Whoa, easy--what is this, Sparta? Kind of on a schedule. Don't have time to toss around the old fire and brimstone. The whole cosmos is basically waiting for me to, you know, conquer it!
(Hades walks away and they dispel their weapons)
Sora Poor Hades. He thinks he can actually pull it off this time.
Hades (calling): Where are my Titans? Show me your power!
(The sky turns dark and the ground shakes. An enormous shadow looms over them and Donald hides behind Sora before a blast of icy wind comes over the mountain. Above, lava flows from a nearby precipice)
Hades Ahh! Love the breeze.
(The wind gains speed and sheds its icy qualities. The three struggle to hold on but are swept up and off the mountain. Hades looks over his handiwork)
Hades Ahh. That sent 'em sailing.
(He pauses)
Hades Sailing right to where I left...
(He turns away casually)
Hades Eh, no biggie.
(He gazes upward at the Titans)
Hades Nice work, boys! So, back to the whole cosmic coup thing?
(They retreat into the mountain again. Hades waves as a corridor of darkness appears behind him)
Hades Ugh. Really? Are you kidding? Geez Louise. Seriously, when it rains, it pours. Okay, who's the new pest?
(He turns to see...)
Pete Hey, now, that ain't no way to say hello, 'specially to your old friends.
(Pete and Maleficent emerge from the portal)
Hades Oh, perfect. Now I gotta put up with you two. Funny, I don't remember you doing me any memorable favors. So, you can keep your Heartless this time. I'm going back to my original plan. All right? So...toodle-oo! Exit's thataway.
(He points to his left)
Hades Hey, it was great seein' ya! (singing) Happy traaails!
Maleficent We are not here for you. I have my own business to attend to. All I need to know is if there is a distinctive...black box somewhere in this world?
Hades Black box, huh?
(He thinks)
Hades Hmm... Black box, black box, black box... Wait. Don't tell me... You're after the one Zeus hid on earth?
Maleficent Possibly. If I were, where might it be?
(Elsewhere, in the city of Thebes, Hercules wipes his hands together, having done some heavy lifting, when upon hearing the sound of screams, he turns, seeing Sora, Donald and Goofy flying towards him. His eyes widen and he jumps into the air, catching Sora and Goofy in both arms. He lands on one knee and stands)
Sora See? Found him.
Goofy Yeah, guess this counts!
(Hercules chuckles)
Donald Get me down!
(Herc turns to see Donald caught on the fangs of a lion statue)
Hercules Just a second!
(Donald yells and crosses his arms with a glare. After Hercules saves him...)
Hercules You guys are here! Sora, Donald, Goofy! You literally dropped in. Gotta say, I'm impressed.
Donald Thanks!
Goofy Liked the catch.
Sora Yeah, thanks Herc. But...what's going on?
(Sora looks around at the burning city, smoke plumes billowing into the sky. Several cracked stone building surround them. Hercules sighs)
Hercules Take a guess. Starts with an H.
Sora Ah, I get the picture. Actually, we bumped into the H-ster on the way here.
Donald (nodding): Uh-huh.
Goofy He said somethin' about conquerin' the whole cosmos.
Hercules All of it, huh? Nice of him to show a little self-restraint. Well, whatever he's planning, I'll send him running back across the Styx.
(He strikes a hero pose and Sora mimics him)
Sora That's our Herc!
(The four of them walk through the city toward a gigantic statue of our famous hero himself)
Hercules So Sora, is there a reason you guys are visiting? I'm guessing it's not just for the cheese and olives.
Sora Oh yeah!
Goofy It sounds like somebody forgot.
Donald That's Sora.
(Sora crosses his arms)
Sora I just...took my time remembering. Herc, I came here so I could ask you something.
Hercules Ask ME?
Sora Yeah. Do you remember the last time we were together? You were feeling down and out. How'd you get your strength back--when you jumped in and saved Meg?
Hercules Hmm...that's tough. All I know is that she was in trouble. Suddenly, I wanted to save her with all my heart, but...it's not like I could tell you how.
Sora (looking down): Oh, man.
Hercules What's wrong?
Sora All my strength is gone from me too. That's why I need you--because I was hoping you might have a solution, or something.
Hercules I'm sorry, Sora.
(Donald sees a shower of meteors over Herc's shoulder, but on closer look, they're actually...)
Donald Heartless!
(Most of the Heartless land, while one strikes the statue of Hercules on the foot, causing the enormous statue to topple over. The trio take out their weapons)
Hercules Let's talk later!
Sora Right...once we've dealt with these guys.
(They fight the group of Flame Cores)
??? Hercules!
(Herc turns to see a flying white horse, Pegasus, land with a whinny near them, carrying Megara and Philoctetes. Meg, as her friends call her, jumps down from Pegasus with Phil in tow)
Meg You're okay!
Hercules Meg!
Meg Boy, that didn't look so fun.
Hercules No, not with the Heartless involved. We're just lucky our friends showed up.
Meg (smiling): Well, whaddaya know? Sora, Donald, Goofy, guess I owe you a big thank you.
Hercules Meg, you need to stay someplace safe. We'll search the city and make sure everyone manages to get clear of the fire.
Meg Be careful, Wonderboy.
Hercules I will.
(He turns to the trio)
Hercules So, you guys in?
Sora Of course we're in!
Donald We're heroes!
Goofy Mm-hmm!
Meg Break a leg then...heroes.
(They strike a pose. Meg walks back to Pegasus)
Hercules Phil, you should go with Meg.
(Phil nods and follows her, leaping aboard the horse. Hercules approaches and strokes his mane. Pegasus lets off a loud whinny)
Hercules You gotta keep her safe.
(Pegasus responds with a serious stare before taking off into the sky. The four watch until they're out of sight)
???? Heeelp!
(Goofy lifts an ear and listens)
???? Is anyone theeere?
Goofy Hey! I hear a voice!
Hercules From which way?
(Goofy points to their left)
Goofy Over that way.
(Hercules looks up to see a young girl trapped on a large rock against a stone wall)
Girl Help meee!
(She almost slips)
Hercules Oh no! There's a little girl caught in the fire!
Sora (running ahead): Let's go!
Hercules Wait. Running's too slow!
(Sora slides to a stop)
Sora Then what's the other choice?
(Herc thinks and turns to the fallen statue)
Hercules (pointing): Get on that.
(Donald, Goofy and then Sora climb aboard the cape of the statue)
Donald Is it safe?
Goofy (shrugs): Hope so.
Sora Like this?
Hercules That's good. Now hold on tight!
(They hang on as Hercules lifts the gigantic statue above his head with a grunt)
Sora Wh-- Wha-- Whoooa! Herc, m-maybe we should... I don't think this is a good idea!
(Hercules aims the statue toward the fire and sends it sailing)
Sora Oh no! Not agaaaaaain!
(They successfully rescue the girl in time)
Girl Thank you for saving me.
(She bows)
Sora Yeah, no prob.
(She giggles and runs off)
Sora We better check and see if anyone else needs us.
(Donald and Goofy nod)
Donald Yep.
(Maleficent portals in behind them)
Maleficent Well, if it isn't Sora and the King's pawns.
(They turn in surprise as Pete follows her)
Sora Maleficent! Pete!
(The trio brandishes their weapons)
Sora Are you the reason the Heartless are here?
Maleficent Certainly not.
(Pete eyes Sora carefully)
Pete Say, Maleficent, I dunno about his sidekicks, but Kid Keyblader here looks way punier than the last time we saw him.
(Sora frowns)
Pete I say we finish him off while we still can.
Maleficent Waste no time with the boy. He's inconsequential. We have a far more pressing matter to attend to.
(Pete crosses his arms and raises an eyebrow in thought)
Pete Oh! We gots to find that black box.
Maleficent Be silent, you fool!
(Pete grimaces at her outburst)
Maleficent As for you three: we shall meet again...when I have time for such trifles.
(She turns and enters a portal of darkness)
Pete Yeah, and youse better get your act together before then. Later, twerps!
(He waves them off and follows the witch)
Sora Wait!
(Sora runs after them but the portal closes in time. Sora stops, his shoulders slumping)
Donald Sora?
(Sora sighs, looking crestfallen)
Sora It's fine. I can take it.
Goofy Gawrsh, it sure don't sound like it. Did Pete sayin' mean things bother ya?
(Sora crosses his arms)
Sora (petulantly): It's fine! I can take it.
Donald You're gonna get stronger!
Goofy We know ya! You CAN take it!
Sora Don't say that!
Goofy (to Donald): I just said what he said.
Donald He can take it!
(They proceed through the city, when another barrage of Flame Cores bursts through the buildings ahead, causing Goofy to yell. They defeat the Heartless and continue onward, however the path forward remains engulfed in flames. Sora approaches, but is burned)
Sora Ouch!
Donald Now what are we gonna do?
(Goofy holds his shield out in front of him and pushes it against the fire. Seeing that he's okay, he turns to them)
Goofy Fellas! I just got a crazy idea!
(Sora and Donald catch on)
Sora The shield!
Goofy Ready?
(Goofy tosses the shield to the ground and Sora and Donald leap aboard. Goofy gets ready to push)
Goofy Here goes!
(The shield slides forward over the fiery bricks as Goofy jumps on. They ride the shield sled-style through the flames as debris falls around them. At the end of the path, the flames die down and they hop off just as a huge fiery rock shoots from the sky)
Donald The building!
(An immense structure held up by numerous stone pillars crumbles to the ground)
Goofy Gawrsh, I hope they've got insurance.
Sora If there's anybody else stuck out here, we'd better find 'em fast.
(They enter the Gardens section of the city where a young woman is trapped on top of a pillar, surrounded by Flame Core Heartless)
Woman Someone, heeelp!
(She peers over the edge of the pillar)
Woman Where did all these monsters come from? Hercules, where are youuu?!
(Sora, Donald and Goofy run up)
Donald Look!
Sora Oh no!
Goofy Help is on the way!
(They run down the stairs towards the fray and the woman sees them)
Sora We'll put these hotheads out!
Goofy Hang on up there!
Woman Huh? Who are you three? Where is Hercules?
Donald Hey, we're heroes too!
(The defeat the Heartless and the young woman descends from the pillar, running over to them)
Woman Thank you. You're so kind. Keep training and one day you'll be great heroes just like Hercules.
(She giggles and waves, leaving Sora's smile to falter)
Sora "Keep training"? Is it that obvious?
Donald Just for you.
Sora Hey!
Goofy I think we all have a ways to go. But we'll get there together!
Sora Yeah, we will.
(Donald gives a sheepish look. On their way out of the Gardens, another meteor destroys a tower in the city. Pasing through an Alleyway, they enter the destroyed building and find Hercules stopping it from crashing onto a family inside)
Sora Herc!
Hercules Sora!
(The trio runs in as the building continues to erode. Hercules struggles to hold it as debris rains down on all sides, sending up swirls of dust. The exit collapses)
Donald Nooo!
(Heartless surround the terrified family)
Sora More Heartless!
Hercules You take them. We need to save these people!
(Sora runs up and summons his Keyblade)
Sora Herc, can you hold the building?
Hercules (grunting): No problem!
Sora Donald. Goofy. We gotta do this quick!
(The trio make quick work of the Heartless while Herc shouts words of encouragement until his strength starts to waver)
Hercules (urgently): Get the people out!
Sora Okay!
(They run over to the three Olympians)
Sora Are you guys all right? You need to get to safety.
Goofy Hurry, hurry!
Sora Go! Quickly!
(As they run out a hole in the wall, Sora pauses, worried as Hercules begins to falter. Rounding the corner the ground starts to shake as the building collapses. Huddling together, Goofy summons his shield as a dust cloud blasts toward them. They look up as the last of the fallen rocks trickle to the ground. Goofy dispels his shield as Sora walks toward the rubble)
Sora, Donald & Goofy: Hercules!
(Facing no response, the trio frowns before hearing footsteps. A large figure walks out of the cloud of dust, the hero himself coming into view. Hercules dusts off his armor and they exclaim joyfully. Herc brushes his chin with a sigh of relief)
Sora You scared us!
Hercules It's nothing. That's what these are for.
(Herc flexes his biceps. Goofy chuckles and he and Donald mimic Herc. They hear a portal open and a familiar, though unwanted, face steps through, peering at them through his yellow eye)
?????? (clapping): Oh, wow! Very nice, full marks.
Donald Go away!
Goofy No Organization!
Sora You're Xigbar!
Xigbar All this altruism is giving me the warm and fuzzies. So then, does having a heart of light come with an extremely good insurance policy?
Sora Just say what you mean.
Xigbar Oh, but I did though. No good will ever come from putting other people first.
Hercules I was able to save Meg's life because I was ready to risk my own.
Xigbar Because you've got friends in high places, you mean. Tricks like that don't fly for your average joe.
(Hercules is speechless)
Sora What do you know? You weren't even there! If you were, you'd admire Herc's courage.
Xigbar I don't admire one guy leaping into danger if it means someone else might have to jump in to save him. You're all just lining up to lose out. Dooming others to take the fall with ya. Oh, and you can spare me the usual party line. Yes, hearts are powerful when they're connected. But if you put too much of that power in one place, some of those hearts might end up breaking.
(He points toward Sora)
Xigbar Still, Sora, that doesn't mean you should change. Accept the power you're given. Find the hearts joined to yours.
Sora Why would I ever take advice from YOU?
Xigbar As if! You don't have any choice but to follow this sweet little trail of bread crumbs. And at the end, you'll finally realize what destiny has in store for you. In fact, your reward might be right around the corner. You're so close!
(Xigbar walks away from them, laughing to himself, and vanishes)
Sora Hearts breaking? Whose hearts?
Hercules Sora, don't let him bother you. He's just trying to get under your skin 'cause he thinks he can. But we'll prove him wrong. We'll show him that our sacrifices haven't been for nothing.
(Sora's face brightens)
Sora You're right.
Goofy Mm-hmm! Besides, we're already proof enough!
Donald We're a team! When we're together, we can do anything!
Sora Yeah!
(They continue walking along, before Sora stops, gazing at the spot where Xigbar disappeared)
Sora ...What reward?
(Heading further into the city, they blast through a small aqueduct, finding a large group of Heartless near the plaza fountain being led by a Rock Troll Heartless. They defeat the monstrous being and its tiny underlings when Pegasus returns carrying Meg and Phil. He lands with a winny, tucking his wings to the side)
Meg Nice job, Wonderboy.
(Herc puts a fist on his hip)
Meg We checked the whole area. It looks like everyone's safe.
(Pegasus nods)
Hercules That's great. We did what we could.
Meg You heroes have been busy little bees.
(Sora, Donald and Goofy smile excitedly, eliciting a small laugh from Megara. Pegasus alerts them to something up ahead. Phil peers over Meg's shoulder)
Meg Oh... Look. More trouble!
(Ominous dark clouds swirl over Mount Olympus)
Hercules It's Hades.
(Sora nods to both Donald and Goofy in turn)
Sora Herc! Let's go!
Hercules Right!
(Pegasus takes flight as the party makes their way toward the mountain. They travel across a ravine and ascend its steep cliffs. As they get closer to the summit, huge tremors shake the ground beneath them)
Goofy This sure does feel awfully familiar...
Sora Yeah, just like before.
Hercules Guys, this is getting worse by the minute. I hope I'm wrong, but my family may need me.
(He whistles into the sky and Pegasus swoops in, landing next to Herc)
Hercules Sora, I'm gonna fly ahead.
(Pegasus nods)
Hercules You've been a big help, but...leave the rest to me.
Sora Family?
(Hercules mounts his friendly steed)
Hercules Yeah. Dad's king of the gods.
(He takes off before they can respond)
Sora, Donald & Goofy: Whaaat?!
Sora His father is a god? But doesn't that mean Herc is a god too?
Goofy I think it does.
Donald No wonder he's so strong!
Goofy Then he'll be okay.
Donald Won't he?
Sora No. Organization XIII's here. He'll need our help.
Goofy Good point. We gotta go!
Donald (looking ahead): 'Cause heroes never quit.
(Sora thinks back to what Hercules told him earlier)
Hercules Hmm...that's tough. All I know is that she was in trouble. Suddenly, I wanted to save her with all my heart...
Sora We fight with all our heart.
(He looks determined)
Sora C'mon!
(The three of them continue forward, when a loud boom shakes the ground. They look over to see part of the mountain moving)
Donald & Goofy: Titan!
(The colossal Rock Titan tosses a gigantic boulder over the mountainside. The trio run away as it crashes, splitting into pieces. One rock blocks the exit back down the mountain. The tension is palpable as Sora races up the sharp walls dodging barrages of rocks thrown by the Rock Titan. One huge boulder strikes the cliff next to him, sending a rock slide over the edge, just a foot away. As they get closer, they enter the dark clouds and their view of the sun is obstructed. The Titan sees them getting nearer and stomps a foot against the precipice, causing a torrent of boulders in Sora's direction. With some quick footwork, he leaps from rock to rock, quickening his pace to the summit. A lit flame guides their way forward through a cave further ahead where they see flashes of light, proof that they have reached the thick of the storm clouds. Fighting Heartless in their path, the rain beats down in currents and lightning strikes the area around them. The Rock Titan, illuminated by the bolts in the air, hones in on the Keyblade wielder, sending a personal gift in his direction. It strikes just past his face, breaking the mountainside and blocking off the cave. For all the Titan's attempts, they succeed in reaching the Rock Titan. They strike at its feet, dodging when it tries to stomp them until cracks begin to show, causing the monster to fall against the mountain with a growl. With the Titan nearly motionless, they ascend their gigantic foe, striking at the two heads on its bulky body. Rain continues to pour as a power emerges from Sora in the shape of an illuminated train on magical roller coaster tracks. The trio ride in the train cars as sparks fly from the chimney of the Mountain Coaster. The Rock Titan attempts to punch the incoming train, but Sora sends a barrage of fireworks at the monster. The Titan howls and careens off the side of the mountain, tumbling all the way down. The three watch it fall)
Sora Yes! That's one down!
Goofy They're not so tough by themselves.
Donald That one was dumb as a rock.
Sora Okay! What's next?
(They follow the pathway ahead, following a cave to escape the storm. Bursting through a pile of rocks, they enter a bright light, finding a grand stairway into the clouds. Their spirits lightened, they rush up the stairs to a golden door and enter the Realm of the Gods)
Sora Whoa! Is this...Olympus?
Goofy Gawrsh, it's amazing!
(Trumpets sound suddenly, startling them)
Donald The fanfare?
Sora Nope!

Star 3: Whoever said love and hate are two sides of the same coin is a liar. The second our eyes would meet, we were at each others' throats, every time. The idea of us as friends is laughable. Star 4: We were always together. Practically joined at the hip. We'd wear the same clothes, eat the same food, go the same places. We were an identical pair--like walking alongside a mirror. Star 5: "I have nothing left to teach you." I had thought those words would make him happy, but it was sorrow that clouded his face. I had shared all I know, my every technique. This wasn't just about passing on knowledge. It was a communion. A connecting of hearts.

Star 7: Did I matter? What I ever there at all? I thought I'd found my place, surrounded by people I trusted. But look there. I'm gone, yet they go on meeting up just the same. Hm? The table's set wrong. There are too many glasses... Oh. Added a new member, have they? That didn't take long. That was my seat. That was MY place at the table. Their glasses clink against the newcomer's, one after the next. No, this is not my place. Maybe it never was.
Star 8: We spent so many years together. A lifetime. It wasn't all sunshine and rainbows, of course. We had our share of troubles. Sorrows, too. But all of it is dear to me now, every minute we had. We got to experience so much. I have no regrets. At least, that's what I thought. Special occasions may stand out, but there's nothing so precious as the quiet days between them. That's what a life is, really...
Star 9: I was defeated. That was supposed to be it. I'd just...fade away. Yet a part of me remains. But why? I have no regrets. No reason to cling to this life. I turn these questions over in my head again and again, and again and again I remember. Our clash. The feeling of exhilaration. Of pleasure. I can see his face clearly in my mind. He wore the same grin as mine. I would dearly love to cross blades with him again...
Star 10: After long years of service, my one regret is that I must pass on before my master. I suspect he will not notice my absense. I doubt he so much as knew my name. Yet how, then, can I explain this sight? The artworks that I was tasked with tending now bear a thin layer of dust. It seems he expressly commanded that none of the remaining staff take up my work. What can that mean, save that he saw me not as one among many, but as an individual? That he feels my absence. Grieves for me. I am awash with gratitude at the thought of it. I must do all that I can to reciprocate... Star 11: Oh, good. If you're speaking to me, I suppose I must exist. I feel a consciousness, or memories, perhaps. Feelings. They pass through my mind one after the next, but none of it feels real. And that was fine. I'd resigned myself to simple forget. To let it all slip away. But there was one piece I couldn't let go of--a fragment I couldn't forget. Maybe that sliver of memory is what's kept me here this whole time...
Star 12: That's strange. I'm running and running, but I can't get to Papa. Oh! This is hide-and-seek! I love hide-and-seek! I"m going to find Papa. He'll be so proud. Hmm... I can't find him. I give up, Papa! Come out! Come out! ...I've looked so hard for him. Isn't he looking for me? Wait, that's Papa's voice. I hear his voice! It's that light! I understand, now.
